result.execSummary:
The defendant David R Hayes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, David R Hayes was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David R Hayes is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • David R Hayes was found guilty of Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Sex offender evaluation and recommended treatment
No contact with victim or her immediate family
Court defers sex offender registry at this time
Supervision fees as determined by Agent
Letter of apology to the victim and her family, to be approved by his probation Agent

Defendant David R Hayes in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 9:07am on Record - Jury absent - Defendant will testify - Court questions defendant as to testifying - Court finds defendant knowingly, freely and voluntarily gives up rights to remain silent and will testify - Jury present - 9:09 am SH called - Sworn - Direct by Laufenberg - 9:18am Cross by Zengler - 9:22am David Hayes called - Sworn - Direct by Laufenberg - 9:33am Cross by Zengler - 9:55am Redirect by Laufenberg - Defense rests - 9:57am State calls rebuttal witness - AP called - Sworn - 9:59 am - Jury absent - Statements by Zengler - Response by Laufenberg - Court will not allow rebuttal witness to testify - 10:07am recess - 10:37am off record - Court reviews jury instructions with counsel - 100, 103, 147, 148, 57, 190, 195, 1208, 2138, 140,, 300, 160 then arguments 460, 484, 515 - 10:44am Jury present - Court instructs jury - 10:56am Closing arguments by Zengler - 11:11am Closing arguments Laufenberg - 11:47am Rebuttal Zengler - Objection, overruled - 11:58am instruction by court - Special verdict form read - 12:02pm alternate juror drawn - 12:04pm Bailiffs sworn - 12:04pm Deliberations begin - 1:40pm jury present, verdict reached - Count 1 not guility - 1:45pm jurors have been released - Court dismisses count 1 and judgment entered on count 2 - Statements by Zengler as to sentencing -  Statement by victim as to sentencing - Statements by Laufenberg to sentencing - Statements by defendant to sentencing - 
Sentence withheld - 2 years probation - Sex offender evaluation and treatment - No contact with victim or her immediate family - CC - 5 days jail with huber to begin 12/9/16 4:30pm-  Court defers sex offender registry at this time - Post conviction rights given

Defendant David R Hayes in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 11:34am Jury present - 11:35am Jurors sworn - 11:36am Opening statement by Zengler - 11:48am Opening statement Laufenberg - 12:01pm Opening statements complete - Back on record at 1:00pm - Jury excused for lunch at 12:02pm - 1:07pm Jury present - Note pads being given to jurors - 1:10pm SS called - Sworn - Direct by Zengler - stipulation to identification of defendant - 1:27pm Cross by Laufenberg - 1:41pm Sidebar - Jury absent - 61 seconds from 1627:10 - 1628:11 - Exhibit #1 marked - 1:45pm jury absent, off reocrd - Equipment issues off record - 2:29pm On record - Statements by Laufenberg - Statements by Zengler Tape times 1632:48 - 1632:59 -2:34pm Jurors present - Deputy Sam Steckbauer called - Sworn - Direct by Zengler - Video being played by Attorney Laufenberg - 2:55pm End of playing of DVD for jury - 2:58pm Cross by Laufenberg - 3:03pm Jury absent - Video being set up - Exhibit #2 marked DVD of Exhibit #1 -3:22pm Counsel and court views portions of DVD in chambers - 3:36pm Jurors present - DVD played for jury - 3:45pm Finished with DVD - Exhibit 3# marked DVD - 3:47pm Ms. Shipway called - Sworn - Direct by Zengler - 3:52pm Cross by Laufenberg - 3:53pm State rests - Jury excused - Jurors to return at 9:00am tomorrow -  Copy of jury instructions provided to counsel - 4:01pm Adjourned
In Limine and Motion to Clarify Trial Procedure
No agreement has been reached - Matter set for 2 days

Defendant David R Hayes in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 3:00pm case called - Deputy Sam Steckbauer called - Sworn - Stipulation to identification of defendant - Cross by Laufenberg - Arguments by Laufenberg - Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds defendant over for trial - Information filed with court - In receipt - Waiver reading - Plea not guilty - JA will contact counsel for scheduling further proceedings - Pretrial in approximately 3 weeks - This will be done telephonically with JA - Bond continued
Branch III Courtroom - Lincoln County Courthouse, Merrill
No contact w/S.L.S, No unsupervised conduct with females under 18 yrs old unless supervised by an adult 25 yrs or older and deft own children are exempt from conditions.
